subject: Football
lead_paragraph: Greg Ellis made a major impact for the Dallas Cowboys at outside linebacker and Saturday was named as The Associated Press’s N.F.L. Comeback Player of the Year. Ellis went from a nonfactor in Dallas to a Pro Bowl player in his new position after spending most of his career as a defensive end. He had 12 ½ sacks, forming a dynamic pass-rushing force with the All-Pro linebacker DeMarcus Ware.
